title: Mahabharata | Part 48 | Brhannala to the rescue | His Grace Suvyakta Narasimha Dasa
speaker: HG Suvyakta Narasimha Dasa

segments.text: Thank you for watching.

On the first day when the ally of Duryodhana attacked the kingdom of Virata, the king Virata, accompanied by the four brothers, Yudhishthira, Bhima, Nakula and Sahadeva, managed to defeat them.
And when they were planning to return to the kingdom of Virata the next day, the next early morning, Duryodhana and his party attacked the kingdom of Virata.
Duryodhana and his party attacked the kingdom of Virata.
On the other end, in response to which, King Virata's son Bhuminjaya, along with Brahmanala, went to counter that attack.
Now that this Brahmanala was Arjuna was unknown to anyone, but Brahmanala revealed to Bhuminjaya when he was completely taken aback by the force of the Kaurava army.
Brahmanala revealed to him that he was Arjuna himself.
And then Bhuminjaya agreed to become his terrier.
And thus, Brahmanala retrieved the weapons of the Pandavas, which was hidden in the semi-tree next to the crematorium.
Now, having retrieved his Gandiva bow, Arjuna sat on the chariot and he blew his conch shell.
And when he blew his conch shell, the Devadatta, by the sound of the conch shell itself and looking at the Gandiva bow, the Kauravas understood that this was Arjuna.
Now, when he blew his conch shell, the Devadatta, by the sound of the conch shell itself and looking at the Gandiva bow, the Kauravas understood that this was Arjuna.
Now, when he blew his conch shell, the Devadatta, by the sound of the conch shell itself and looking at the Gandiva bow, the Kauravas understood that this was Arjuna.
Now that the disguise of the Pandavas was discovered, Duryodhana became very happy.

And why? Because according to the conditions of the Game of Dice, if the Pandavas were discovered during their period of one year of living in incognito, then they would have to go again to the forest in exile for another 12 years.
And the whole purpose of Duryodhana coming to Virata was that only.
Two.

look look look duryodhana is trying to get away let us go and corner him so immediately

not have the courage to face Arjuna alone in battle. And when he saw that Arjuna's chariot
was coming towards him, he dropped his plans of trying to get away all by himself. And he went
back and joined the ranks of the cow rovas, thinking that I stand a better chance when I'm
in the midst of Bhishma Dev and Dronacharya and Karna. And so the cows also, Duryodhana could not
hold them back. And they all went back into the kingdom of Virata. So now the Virata kingdom's
cows had been protected. Now Arjuna came back to the battlefield. And then Karna immediately
jumped into the battle. And he started abusing Arjuna, saying that, oh, Arjuna, today you will
see my arrows will wound you and they will kill you and you will lie on the battlefield and so on
and so forth, as Karna was usually always.
He engaged in boasting. Similarly, he continued in the same way. Arjuna did not hold back.
Arjuna started releasing his arrows. Karna also started releasing his arrows. And both of them
engaged in a pitched battle. But gradually, Arjuna's superiority came to the fore. Slowly,
Karna got wounded everywhere. His bow was broken. His arrows had pierced his arms, his thighs,
his chest. And finally, he told his charioteer,
I cannot stand fighting Arjuna. So he had to run away from the battle. And then when Karna was beaten
back like this, then Dronacharya came forward. And when Dronacharya came forward, Arjuna told him
that, oh, my guru, you are my guru. I will not take up a weapon against you unless you draw the
weapon first. So Dronacharya smiled and he drew his bow and released his arrow. And when Dronacharya
released his arrow, then Arjuna started counterattacking. So the fight went on between
them, the guru and Arjuna. Dronacharya, of course, his full heart was not there in the battle. So he
was not exerting himself fully. So very quickly, Arjuna managed to overpower him. And Dronacharya
being hit by the arrows of Arjuna fainted. And when Dronacharya's charioteer saw that Dronacharya
has fainted, he took him away from the battlefield. Now came forth Bhishmadeva,
Arjuna. Now, between Bhishmadeva and Arjuna also, the fight started in good earnest. And because of
the Kshatriya spirit, both of them were in a really angry mood and they were exchanging arrows. But
again, even Bhishmadeva also could not face, he could not, he could not counter all of Arjuna's
weapons. And Bhishmadeva also soon, he fell, he fell unconscious and his chariot also had to be
taken away. Now, Karna had recuperated and he jumped
back into the battle. And he came in front of Arjuna again, and again, he started fighting.
But very quickly, again, he was defeated. Again, he had to run back from the battle.
So like this, the battle between the Kaurava army and Arjuna went back and forth. And on
this side, Arjuna was all alone. And on the other side, all these Maharashtris, the great
generals, Kripacharya, Ashwathama himself, Dronacharya, Bhishmadeva, all these people, Dushyasana, and
all these people fighting against Arjuna. But none of them were able to overpower him.
Finally, Duryodhana himself came forward and started fighting. Now, Arjuna very quickly
and very easily defeated Duryodhana, but he did not want to kill him. Because he remembered
Bhima's vow to kill all of Duryodhana and his brothers. So he did not kill him, but he very
quickly destroyed his bow and all his arrows. Everything got exhausted. And Bhishmadeva was
and duryodhana had also to retreat so finally when they were when the entire kaurava army was beaten
back like this the the kaurava army decided that we will not be able to face arjuna let us go back
and so all of them left the battlefield and went back to hastinapura so we can see how arjuna was
so powerful all these warriors together could not face arjuna in battle but arjuna did not
pursue them arjuna on the other hand now that they had been defeated and they had left the

he gave it to bhuminjaya and he told him that when we go back to the kingdom of virata don't tell
